meanings.sent1: She had to exert herself to finish the race.
meanings.sent2: He always exerts his best effort in everything he does.
meanings.sent3: The little ant had to exert a lot of energy to carry the heavy leaf.
meanings.sent4: The sun exerted its warmth on the chilly morning, making it more bearable.
meanings.sent5: The determined student exerted all her strength to lift the heavy books.

meanings.sent1: He had to exert pressure on the stubborn jar lid to open it.
meanings.sent2: The machine exerts a lot of force to crush the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to exert force on the squeaky toy.
meanings.sent4: The wind exerted its power on the fragile branches, causing them to sway.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter exerted all his strength to lift the heavy barbell.

meanings.sent1: The leader can exert his influence to make positive changes.
meanings.sent2: She always exerts her power to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to exert his magic on the stubborn rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The CEO exerted her authority to implement new policies.
meanings.sent5: The superhero exerted his strength to save the city from disaster.
